name: Safe Superintelligence Inc. (SSI)
title: Pure Research Lab — No Products, All Compute on Research

classification.classificationRationale: Model 1 (Research Lab). SSI is explicitly positioned as a pure research company: no product teams, no sales, no customer-facing engineering. All compute is concentrated on research rather than fragmented across inference, products, and multiple modalities. Sutskever states 'We are squarely an age of research company.' Structural: the entire company IS the research lab, with clear structural separation from any commercialization function (which doesn't exist yet).

description:
Safe Superintelligence Inc. (SSI), founded by Ilya Sutskever after departing OpenAI, represents the purest exploration model in the AI organizational landscape. The company has no product teams, no sales function, and no customer-facing engineering — all resources are concentrated on fundamental AI research.

With $3B in funding, Sutskever argues that SSI's effective research compute is competitive because competitors dilute their compute across inference, products, sales, and multiple modalities. SSI concentrates everything on research.

Sutskever's organizational philosophy emphasizes hiring 'people who think differently rather than the same' — valuing diversity of thought over scale of headcount. His era framework (2012-2020: age of research, 2020-2025: age of scaling, 2026+: age of research again 'just with big computers') provides the intellectual foundation for SSI's pure-research organizational model.

The company's thesis on 'jaggedness' — models excelling at benchmarks but having limited economic impact — implies current product-focused AI orgs may be misallocating resources, further justifying the research-only model.

mechanisms.name: Protect Off-Strategy Work
mechanisms.evidence: SSI's entire organizational design protects research from product/commercial pressures. No product teams, no sales, no customer-facing engineering — structurally preventing off-strategy work from being diverted to near-term commercial demands.
